LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.NodeInteractionTip:
Left-Click to select.
Right-Click to unpin.
Click and drag to move.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.MaxIterationsTip: The maximum iterations (frames) the dynamic graph will run for.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.ThresholdTip: When all nodes have moved less than the threshold, the graph has reached a stable state - and further iterations are unnecessary.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.MaxTemperatureTip: Temperature controls the level of energy in the system, higher values will have faster, snappier movement - but are also more likely to 'explode'. Temperature is lowered as iterations progress, to produce a gradual slowdown of movement.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.CentralConstantTi: The central force is a force towards the centre of the graph applied to all nodes, in order to stop unconnected nodes drifting away.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.AttractiveConstan: The attractive force is applied between related pawns, and further increased as a function of opinion between the pawns.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.Graph.RepulsiveConstant: The repulsive force is applied to all nodes, and pushes nodes away from eachother. This stops overlapping nodes, and spreads nodes out evenly.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.InvalidFloat: Invalid number. Please use '{0}' as a decimal seperator.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.InvalidInteger: Invalid integer. Only whole numbers are allowed.
LanguageData.Fluffy_Relations.GraphOptionsInformation: The below options allow finetuning of the algorithm that controls the force directed graph - the dynamic view of pawns and their relationships. Please be careful, changing these values can lead to faulty behaviour. Be especially careful with the initial temperature, even slightly higher values will quickly lead to 'exploding' graphs. Pawn spacing can be effectively controlled by lowering/increasing the repulsive force - try setting values of 500 and 5000 to see the effect.
